title: Moment stepmother is reunited with toddler abducted from playground by stranger
text:
Stepmom Shaye Wallace was unable to contain her joy as she was reunited with stepdaughter Ahlora Lindiment, who was abducted from a playground on Wednesday (Pictures: Shaye Wallace)

A stepmother has shared the amazing moment she was reunited with her toddler stepdaughter after a stranger snatched her from a playground.

Shaye Wallace filmed herself grinning from ear-to-ear as she embraced three year-old Ahlora Lindiment in a hospital in Greensboro, North Carolina, on Thursday night.

Shaye said: ‘This is my daughter Ahlora everybody and she is perfect.

‘We want to thank everybody for helping us look for her. We want to thank everybody for the prayers and thoughts. I’m so glad my baby was found. She’s safe, she’s unharmed.’

Ahlora, who looked equally happy to be back with her stepmom, then took the opportunity to interrupt, saying: ‘Mommy, I want to go home.’

The stepmother and daughter were reunited 30 hours after Ahlora was snatched while playing at a playground close to her home.

Police say the woman suspected of kidnapping Ahlora, who is still at large, spent time chatting to other adults and children before making off with the little girl.

She left the youngster at a church the following day.

Her disappearance sparked a frantic search, with Wallace and the rest of the little girl’s family delighted by news of her safe return.

Greensboro Police Chief Wayne Scott said Ahlora appeared to have escaped her ordeal unscathed.

Greensboro Police have released this still of the woman suspected of abducting Ahlora (Picture: Greensboro PD)

His officers are now hunting the suspected abductor, and say they do not know what the motive behind the abduction was.

He told WGHP: ‘The suspect is still at large, and we would ask the community to continue to help us.

‘The obvious thing is for us to find the individual, determine what was the motive, what were the issues, and take our appropriate up to and including any charges that may be relevant.

‘We obviously want to try and find this individual and get them off street so we don’t have a similar issue to occur.’

Scott said a specially-trained police officer will talk to Ahlora today to try and glean more information about what happened after she was taken.
description: Ahlora Lindiment's stepmom Shaye Wallace grinned from ear to ear as she was reunited with the youngster on Thursday evening
